column1: #Text=( Scottish Gaelic : Logarbaidh ) is a small town in Dumfries and Galloway , most famous as the setting for the tragic 1988 crash of Pan Am flight 103 , following the detonation of a bomb on board .
#Text=Lockerbie is just off the A74(M ) which links Glasgow with Carlisle and the south .
#Text=is served primarily by First Transpennine Express trains from Manchester Airport to Glasgow and Edinburgh via Carlisle .
#Text=Occasional Virgin trains may be available from London Euston and Birmingham but trains to these destinations usually require a change at Carlisle .
#Text=Lockerbie is about an hour by train from both Glasgow and Edinburgh and about 2 hours 15 minutes from Manchester ( another 15 minutes gets you to Manchester Airport )
#Text=An exhibition on the history of Lockerbie , and of Flight 103 .
#Text=Built by Ukrainians who came to Scotalnd from Italy in 1947 .
#Text=( Lockerbie Wildlife Trust ) ( Just outside of Lockerbie on the A709 , opposite Dryfesdale Lodge Visitors ' Centre ) .
#Text=Pleasant woodland walks surrounding the site of an old curling pond .
#Text=( Cobwebs Antiques ) , 30 Townhead Street , Lockerbie , DG11 2AG , ☏ +4415762202554 . 09:00 - 17:00 , Closed Sundays .
#Text=Featured on the BBC TV series " Antiques Road Trip " .
#Text=Cosy , casual pub , featuring a pool table and darts .
#Text=Experience the spectacular sights and sounds of the River Annan cascading through the grounds of the peaceful Riverside Mill B&B whilst still only being 3 miles away from the M74 ( M6 ) .
#Text=Less than 5 minutes walk from Lockerbie Train Station , the Townhead offers well-appointed bed and breakfast accommodation .
#Text=There is free WiFi and a private car park .
#Text=Situated in the centre of town , a short walk from the station , with convenient links to local bus services .
#Text=Pet friendly , Wi-Fi throughout hotel , Complimentary bottled water , Tea & Coffee Making Facilities , Meeting facilities
#Text=( The Somerton ) , 35 Carlisle Road , Lockerbie , DG11 2DR , ☏ +441576202583 .

#Text=A privately run country house hotel standing in over three acres of its own grounds and gardens .
